intro: Aethionema capitatum, commonly known as rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Aethionema capitatum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
